intro: Fagaropsis gillettii, commonly known as the Gillett's fagaropsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and pods that contain several seeds. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native habitat.
